Package org.ftccommunity.i2clibrary.interfaces

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAccelerationIntegrator
    IAccelerationIntegrator encapsulates an algorithm for integrating acceleration information over time to produce velocity and position.
    IBNO055IMU
    Interface API to the Adafruit 9-DOF Absolute Orientation IMU Fusion Breakout - BNO055 sensor.
    IFunc<TResult>
    IFunc<TResult> represents a nullary function that returns a val of the indicated type.
    IHandshakeable
    Interface for use with HandshakeThreadStarter
    II2cDevice  
    II2cDeviceClient
    II2cDeviceClient is the public interface to a utility class that makes it easier to use I2cDevice instances.
    II2cDeviceClientUser
    II2cDeviceClientUser allows one to retrieve an underlying I2cDeviceClient from an object that respresents an I2C hardware sensor.
    IOpModeStateTransitionEvents
    An interface used to receive notifications about various OpMode state transitions
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    IBNO055IMU.Parameters
    Instances of Parameters contain data indicating how a BNO055 absolute orientation sensor is to be initialized.
    II2cDeviceClient.HeartbeatAction
    Instances of HeartBeatAction indicate what action to carry out to perform a heartbeat should that become necessary.
    II2cDeviceClient.ReadWindow
    RegWindow is a utility class for managing the window of I2C register bytes that are read from our I2C device on every hardware cycle
    II2cDeviceClient.TimestampedData
    TimestampedData pairs together data which has been read with the timestamp at which the read occurred, as best that can be determined
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    IBNO055IMU.ACCELUNIT  
    IBNO055IMU.ANGLEUNIT  
    IBNO055IMU.I2CADDR  
    IBNO055IMU.PITCHMODE  
    IBNO055IMU.REGISTER
    REGISTER provides symbolic names for each of the BNO055 device registers
    IBNO055IMU.SENSOR_MODE
    Sensor modes are described in Table 3-5 (p21) of the BNO055 specification, where they are termed "operation modes".
    IBNO055IMU.TEMPUNIT  
    II2cDeviceClient.READ_MODE
    READ_MODE controls whether when asked to read we read only once or read multiple times.
